segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, and she looks so calm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water overflowing, and I’m not sure what to think about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is reaching for the cookies, and I’m not sure if he’ll make it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and I’m not sure if anyone will notice before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is watching him, and I’m not sure what she’s thinking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman should turn around and see what’s happening, but I’m not sure she will.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks nice, but inside, it’s a bit of a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the water will ruin the floor, but I’m not sure.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so focused on the cookies, and I’m not sure if he’ll succeed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe the woman is so unaware of everything around her, but I’m not sure what to do about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is a bit confusing to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR
